title.narrative: 001 EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION AND EARLYLEARNING

description.narrative: By 2025, the education system is strengthened to build the foundational skills of girls and boys in pre- and early primary, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2025, girls and boys in Ethiopia, in particular the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations, benefit from an equitable and resilient education system enabling them to acquire relevant knowledge and skills.

participating-org.narrative: B GUMUZ REGIONAL EDUCATION BUREAU REB

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, the education system is strengthened to build the foundational skills of girls and boys in pre- and early primary, with afocus on the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF advocated for and provided technical support for the Government in finalizing the national Early Childhood Development and Education (ECDE) Policy Framework to guide cross-sectoral coordination among line ministries and other partners; supported the development of a draft strategic operational plan for expansion of ECE; supported the training of 1,844;ECE teachers/facilitatorsandschooldirectors(817females; andprovided ECE services to 103,403 children (48%) through both development and humanitarian programming.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:08/01/2022

baseline.value: Total: 130,036 (F= 61,625; M=68,411) (no disaggregation by humanitarian/development interventions) (Cumulative 2016 - 2018)

actual.value: 2021:103,403 children (48% girls). Humanitarian: 47,752 (48% girls) Development: 55,651 children (26,389 girls)
